content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I do it and i like it

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very easy but why not ?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Seems good to me

Goal
* Please state what a stick-man looks like.

Output
* Please mention that there should be a space in each line between adjacent stick-men.

* Please mention that all trailing spaces should not be removed.

Constraints
* Please fix the constraint to be consistent with the cases.

Thanks.

Fixed.
I thought of putting a single stick-man as a comment in the code instead of putting in the goal. But I don't know if this is possible.
Thank you.

It's possible. I can think of three options. Starting from line 3:

1. Add a stick-man in lines 3 to 5 (as part of the write statement - it supports a multi-line argument, so you don't have to repeat "write" every time).

2. Add a STATEMENT block and a stick-man.

3. Add an OUTPUT block and a stick-man.

For options 2 and 3 you may refer to the examples here: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/stub-generator

I read the documentation you provided and tried your options.
There is just a tiny problem. Apparently, text inserted through stub generator ends up trimmed. That means, I can't properly comment that a stick-man's head is " o " because it ends up as "o". I tried the `write join(" o ")` function, but the following `write`s were inserting extra "auto-generated code" comments.

I think it's better to keep things simple and leave the Goal as it is.

Thank you, 5DN1L.
